entries.text: At ZipRecruiter, our goal is to build the best online services for finding and filling jobs. We've grown from 4 to over 100 employees in less than 4 years with zero funding.  We care about code quality and quality of life. To learn more about our business and values, please follow the link above.

entries.text: We are a growing software company using open source software/modern Perl practices to build innovative e-payment, auction, and tax collection web applications. We are looking for talented, motivated professionals committed to flawless work and customer service.

entries.title: The Pittsburgh Perl Workshop 2014 Tilt Campaign
entries.text: Would you like to go to the Pittsburgh Perl Workshop? The organizers ask for your commitment before they start to organize. Go place your tilt for $125.

entries.title: How should conference speakers be compensated?
entries.text: brian d foy explains how the Master Classes he started to run at YAPC::Chicago in 2006 helped financing some of the speakers. IMHO, as I also wrote already this is a win-win and such trainig classes can even help sponsoring other parts of the conference.

entries.title: Rescue legacy code with modulinos
entries.text: Modulino is a Perl module that can be also used as a script. brian d foy explains how this feature can be used to convert scripts into modules and make it easier to start testing them.

entries.title: Curating CPAN sometimes means really deleting stuff
entries.text: Philippe Bruhat (BooK) shows 3 cases when he decide a module should be totally removed from CPAN and uses his examples to encourage others too to remove obsolete modules.

entries.title: Fix a bug on CPAN Day
entries.text: It is Neil Bowers again (I really hope he will create a post linking to all of his CPAN-day related posts) showing how the number of bugs on RT are steadily growing (but not even looking at bugs reported elsewhere). More importantly he created a list of the to 20 distributions in terms of open RT tickets. There are some very important modules in that list! Go ahead, you can fix a bug or at least write a test case.

entries.title: Don't declare a dependency on Crypt::SSLeay (or IO::Socket::SSL either)
entries.text: Instead of that, if your code uses https then declare a dependency on LWP::Protocol::https.
